name: PROSPECTOR
description: Some people aren’t afraid to get their hands dirty. You are one of these individuals and you aren’t afraid to get your mech’s hands dirty, either. Having equipped it with all sorts of industrial mining equipment, your mech is now able to move great amounts of dirt in a very short amount of time, allowing it and its allies to rapidly redeploy using subterranean routes.

ranks.name: Stake a Claim
ranks.description:
Tunnel: When Tunneling, remove the character from the battlefield and then immediately place them in a free and valid space. This is considered moving 1 space and does trigger Reactions.
Gain the “Create Entrance” Quick Action which you may use 1/Scene.
While completely within the Burst of an Entrance during their own turns you and allied characters gain the “Subterranean Reposition” Reaction.

actions.name: Create Entrance
actions.detail: 1/Scene While standing on solid ground you may create a Burst 1 Entrance around yourself as a Quick Action. You may then Tunnel to anywhere 5 spaces away. You then create another Burst 1 Entrance. Entrances remain in play until the end of the Scene. Terrain and Sections of Terrain overlapping the Burst of an Entrance take 20AP Explosive damage. You become unable to take Reactions until the end of the current turn.

actions.name: Subterranean Reposition
actions.trigger: During your turn, you are completely within an Entrance.
actions.detail: Immediately Tunnel. You must end the movement completely within the Burst of a different Entrance created by the same character as the first.

ranks.name: Gold Rush
ranks.description: Hostile characters in the Burst when you create an Entrance must perform a Hull save or are Knocked Prone. After using “Create Entrance” allied characters completely within the Burst of your initial Entrance may use “Subterranean Reposition” even though it is not their turn.

ranks.name: Mother Lode
ranks.description: "Create Entrance" becomes 1/Round and you may use it an additional time each Scene.  All Entrances created by you are connected for the purposes of Tunneling.

name: ICONOCLAST
description: You have acquired an NHP, or has it acquired you? Together you have set out to achieve greatness and push boundaries. The two of you are in it together and you’ll be able to achieve fantastical things. Perhaps you’re unaware of the risks; perhaps you willfully choose to ignore them. The power you can tap into with the help of your companion is, however, undeniable. And with such power, who is to stop the two of you from breaking some taboos?

ranks.name: Transgression
ranks.description: You may choose to equip your mech with an UNSTABLE-NHP system.

ranks.name: Transmutation
ranks.description: After performing any action granted to you by an NHP, excluding handing control of your mech over to the NHP as a protocol, you may immediately perform the TRANSMUTING SPARK free action. Each NHP may only trigger this action 1/round.

actions.name: Transmuting Spark
actions.detail: Project a LINE 3 lightning arc as a free action. Characters of your choice in the LINE take 2 AP energy damage.

ranks.name: Transcension
ranks.description:
Gain a Transcendence Die, a D3 starting at 3. When using “Transmuting Spark” reduce the die by 1. If the die is already at 1 you may enter a transcendent state and reset the Transcendence Die to 3. The transcendent state lasts until the end of your next turn.
While in this state:
● Your Transcendence Die can’t decrease.
● “Memetic Spark” increases its damage by 4 and Range by 5.
● Unless flying or climbing, you are forced to permanently Hover exactly 1 Space above any surface at all times.
● You become Immune to involuntary movement.
Whenever you cascade and lose control of your mech, you enter a transcendent state for the duration, cascading NHPs have access to this Talent. Your Transcendence Die resets at the end of the Scene.

name: FIELD ANALYST
description: You’ve always been perceptive, able to analyze the flow of battle and come up with strategies on the spot. You’re the mastermind behind the scenes, helping your allies out in battle in various ways. From subtle nudges to your comrades when aiming their weapons to devising advanced firing solutions or tailor-made evasive patterns. With your support, any battle your allies find themselves in is sure to end in success.

ranks.name: Tactical Intelligence
ranks.description: Whenever an allied character in line of sight misses with an attack, you know by how much it missed. Gain access to the “Superior Intelligence” Reaction.

actions.name: Superior Intelligence
actions.trigger: An allied character in Line of Sight has rolled an Attack Roll.
actions.detail: You may add 1 to the attack roll. This may cause an attack to hit or to critically hit. Each attack roll can only be affected once by Superior Intelligence.

ranks.name: Information Handling
ranks.description: At the start of each combat, you gain an Intelligence Die, a d6 starting at 1. At the end of your turn, if you didn’t take any actions that affected a hostile character during your turn, except Scan, your Intelligence Die increases by 2. Whenever you use Superior Intelligence, you may increase the attack roll by the value of your Intelligence die instead of 1. It is reset to 1 afterwards. The Intelligence Die lasts until the end of the Scene.

ranks.name: Active Interference
ranks.description: Whenever a hostile character in line of sight hits with an attack you know what they rolled. You may use the Superior Intelligence Reaction when a hostile character in Line of Sight has rolled an Attack Roll. Instead of adding to the attack roll you subtract from it in the same manner. Each attack roll can only be affected once by Superior Intelligence.
